programme.title: Repair Hacks for Beginners and PRO!
programme.desc: Discover ingenious plumbing solutions, renovation shortcuts, and self-made repair tools—all crafted from natural elements and traditional methods. No plastic, no waste—just the pure, sustainable brilliance of hands-on ingenuity!

programme.title: Lions On The Move
programme.desc: Kevin Richardson shares an extraordinary bond with Africa’s most fearsome predators. Together with them, he has experienced some real adventures. However, transporting 27 lions and 14 hyenas to a new home presents a different challenge.The lions new home will be a sanctuary on the edge of Dinokeng, a South African game reserve spanning 18,000 square metres. The huge task ahead includes planning and designing the new enclosures, and securing permits to move the animals.

programme.title: Wild Switzerland
programme.desc: Gentle, green meadows, rugged rock faces, mysterious lakes, dense forests, tall mountains, low-lying river deltas, quietly meandering mountain streams and smack dab in the middle, a unique fauna - THIS is Switzerland! We trace the elementary power of nature and present animals and plants in landscapes that have hardly ever been touched by mankind. Switzerland is an alpine country, but it is also Europes surge tank. Rivers such as the Rhine and the Rhone have their sources here. Glaciers, crevasses, icy cold caves and the underwater dome of the Verzasca are the unusual settings we chose for this film. We meet with rare, selected animal species and present their behavioural patterns, such...

programme.title: Wild Skagerrak
programme.desc: The strait that connects the North Sea with the Baltic, with depths of over 700 metres, is notorious for its dangerously strong currents. But currents also mean food and therefore nourishment for the large swarms of fish that inhabit the region. The sea grass meadows are comparable with those off the Californian coast. Harbour seals, grey seals and orcas hunt here, as do the rare black mouth cat shark and porpoises. Close by, catfish mate, which in itself is quite spectacular and never caught on film in this way before. Lions mane jellyfish with nettle threads of up to 30 metres in length make their way through the open sea. Skagerraks coastal regions are amongst the most beautiful and...

programme.title: Wild Sardinia
programme.desc: Sardinia has always been the epitome of pure wilderness, an emerald of volcanic origin in the Mediterranean. 1900 metres of coastline and an infinite maze of offshore islands. But Sardinia also has other facets: green valleys, rugged mountains, murmuring brooks, mysterious ruins and a unique fauna. Just off of Sardinias coast is an untouched underwater paradise - uniquely beautiful, but also dangerous. Pilot whales, dolphins and mobula rays populate the waters at Capo Testa in the north of the island. In the west, the lagoons of Cabras represent a wild landscape of lakes in which thousands of flamingos live and hunt the red brine shrimps. In addition to the flamingos, grey and purple...

programme.title: Secrets of the Mediterranean
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Secrets of the Mediterranean, Ep.1
programme.desc: The contours of the Mediterranean have changed during the course of its history. Near Gibraltar, Africa was once connected to the European continent. When the land bridge at Gibraltar collapsed, the Mediterranean basin filled up again. The Suez Canal is today connected to the Red Sea. This route enables animals to reach the Mediterranean, where they cause problems.

programme.title: Secrets of the Mediterranean
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Secrets of the Mediterranean, Ep. 2
programme.desc: Rugged rocks, blue sea and idyllic, sandy beaches - this is the Mediterranean as we know it. But this impression is deceptive: the Mediterranean is under constant change. The continents are moving towards one another. Animals, that have to survive under such extreme conditions, must find a way to escape the dangers. Between deserts and volcanoes, the challenges for the animals are enormous.

programme.title: Chiemgau, A Changing Landscape
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Chiemgau, A Changing Landscape: Episode 1
programme.desc: A few thousand years ago, there were bare moraine ridges and barren meltwater valleys here. A landscape born in the last ice age, characterized by the edge of the Alps, gentle hills, moors, and lakes. And by cultural richness, not only on the islands in Lake Chiemsee, with their famous monasteries and castles. Long before King Ludwig II, the first people settled in the Chiemgau region. Finds of hunting weapons from the Neanderthal era prove that the land was inhabited even during the ice age, probably because there was plenty of game to hunt. During the Bronze Age, one of the most important trade routes from the mountains to the Alpine foothills passed through here. Then came the Celts...

programme.title: Chiemgau, A Changing Landscape
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Chiemgau, A Changing Landscape: Episode 2
programme.desc: Three times in the past two decades, the Chiemsee area has experienced "once-in-a-century" floods. Climate, wildlife, and landscape have changed, and it seems this transformation is accelerating. Species living in the flood zones are developing sophisticated survival strategies. Knot ants, for instance, place their queen in the middle and form a raft with their bodies, even conquering new habitats. Flooding is less of a disaster for nature and impacts humans more significantly.

programme.title: Europes Wild River - The Elbe - 1.000 Miles of Wildlife and Nature
programme.desc: The river rises in the Czech Giant Mountains. Here it is called the Labe. After Děčín it flows into Germany and is called Elbe. There are various explanations for the origin of the river name "Elbe". One often mentioned is the Latin name of the river "albia", which means "bright water". This would also explain why the stream is referred to with the feminine article "the Elbe", since the Latin term "albia" is also feminine. Rather poetic than linguistically probable, however, is the explanation that elves (Middle High German: alb) scurrying around the pines in the white river mists could have helped the river to get its name. Geographically, the river can be divided into different...

programme.title: Alpine Lakes - Dark Depths and Icy Heights
programme.desc: This is a nature documentary, which leads us into the fascinating world of deep mountain lakes. We conquer ice palaces of unsuspected beauty. In the freezers, in which elves, fairies and mountain trolls once did their mischief, we move, using a special breathing technique and with special cameras in search of nocturnal hunters, whose eyes are equipped with residual light amplifying receptors.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The Secret World of Herbs - In Provence
programme.desc: Its native fragrant flowers and aromatic herbs have made the Provence a brand known worldwide. The wealth of flora found in this region, between the French Alps and the Mediterranean, is unequalled among the French provinces. Around Sault, near Mont Ventoux, the valleys and high plains are carpeted with bright violet: In the hot climate of the South of France, lavender blooms and exudes its fragrance. Monastic healers have been using its aromatic medicinal oil since the Middle Ages. And today an entire industry is based on the trade with this fragrant flower. Yet the livelihood of Provençal lavender farmers is imperiled. In France’s major lavender-growing region, the “Plateau de...

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 The Secret World of Herbs - In India
programme.desc: In India, herbs play an everyday role hardly equalled anywhere in the world. From the tropical green south to the mountains of the northern Himalayas, herbs lend fragrance to joss sticks and soaps, and flavor to the cuisine. And, above all, herbs heal. Six thousand varieties of plants are used in India, and most are harvested in the wild – where they are becoming depleted. The ever rising need for herbal medicine for the subcontinent’s 1.3 billion inhabitants comes on top of the demand of its growing middle class for herbal-based cosmetics. As a result, certain herbs have become scarce, while others have already vanished entirely. Most of the herbs in India are harvested in the wild. The...

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 The Secret World of Herbs - In Latin America
programme.desc: Healing effects, fragrance, and intense flavor – the benefits of herbs were discovered by the indigenous peoples of South America long before Spanish conquistadores subdued the continent. Even today, in the remote regions of South America, life without herbs is unthinkable. For many inhabitants, they provide the sole medicine. For more than two thousand years, this wisdom of the healing powers of nature has been passed down from generation to generation. In Bolivia, the film accompanies ethnobiologist Rainer Bussmann on one of his expeditions documenting which herbs the locals use against which illnesses. The German scientist has spent the last 15 years in the region, focussed on...

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 The Secret World of Herbs - In the Alps
programme.desc: Secluded for many centuries in inaccessible valleys, the inhabitants of the Alps had no alternative but to rely on the healing powers of nature. A knowledge of herbs was deeply rooted in these mountain-dwellers’ everyday lives – until the twentieth century, when this wisdom became eclipsed by modern academic medicine. Today, Alpine herbs are witnessing a revival, as public interest in regional natural treasures grows. The potential of Alpine herbs is far from exhausted. In the Berchtesgaden Alps, the film shows Hubsi Ilsanker at work as a root-digger, a back-breaking job that has scarcely changed in four hundred years. Authorized by a special historic permit to supply the oldest gentian...

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 The Secret world of Herbs - In the Balkans
programme.desc: In the pristine nature and mild climate of southeastern Europe grows a unique diversity of wild plants. Far removed from major industry and polluted soils, the Balkan countries have become the largest exporter of herbs in Europe. In Bulgaria alone, more than 300,000 people work with domestic plants. The business is becoming increasingly lucrative. The film takes us to the Croatian coast. On the Adriatic island of Cres, the audience meets Mladen Dragoslavić. In May, when the sage begins to blossom, this beekeeper has one month to produce his income for an entire year – always with the goal of creating the best sage honey in the Balkans. Given a choice, the bees would never choose sage, for...

programme.title: Italy My Love
programme.desc: In ten coastal areas of Italy, we encounter people that have a very special relationship with their region. All of them love their country, their traditions and their work. We met with enthusiasts and hedonists that permitted us to take a glimpse into their everyday lives. Young Italians, who have rediscovered nature and its treasures. Others, that preserve the beauty, archaeologists that apply whole new methods, farmers that only cultivate that which the soil needs. Fishermen, who fish in the same way as it was done a century ago and tough, young men who play and dance the Tarantella. Dolphins, giant sea turtles and pink flamingos, which are researched, nursed back to health or simply...

Glaciers, crevasses, icy cold caves and the underwater dome of the Verzasca are the unusual settings we chose for this film. We meet with rare, selected animal species and present their behavioural patterns, such...

programme.title: Wild Skagerrak
programme.desc: The strait that connects the North Sea with the Baltic, with depths of over 700 metres, is notorious for its dangerously strong currents. But currents also mean food and therefore nourishment for the large swarms of fish that inhabit the region. The sea grass meadows are comparable with those off the Californian coast. Harbour seals, grey seals and orcas hunt here, as do the rare black mouth cat shark and porpoises. Close by, catfish mate, which in itself is quite spectacular and never caught on film in this way before. Lions mane jellyfish with nettle threads of up to 30 metres in length make their way through the open sea. Skagerraks coastal regions are amongst the most beautiful and...

programme.title: Wild Sardinia
programme.desc: Sardinia has always been the epitome of pure wilderness, an emerald of volcanic origin in the Mediterranean. 1900 metres of coastline and an infinite maze of offshore islands. But Sardinia also has other facets: green valleys, rugged mountains, murmuring brooks, mysterious ruins and a unique fauna. Just off of Sardinias coast is an untouched underwater paradise - uniquely beautiful, but also dangerous. Pilot whales, dolphins and mobula rays populate the waters at Capo Testa in the north of the island. In the west, the lagoons of Cabras represent a wild landscape of lakes in which thousands of flamingos live and hunt the red brine shrimps. In addition to the flamingos, grey and purple...

programme.title: Secrets of the Mediterranean
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Secrets of the Mediterranean, Ep.1
programme.desc: The contours of the Mediterranean have changed during the course of its history. Near Gibraltar, Africa was once connected to the European continent. When the land bridge at Gibraltar collapsed, the Mediterranean basin filled up again. The Suez Canal is today connected to the Red Sea. This route enables animals to reach the Mediterranean, where they cause problems.

programme.title: Secrets of the Mediterranean
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Secrets of the Mediterranean, Ep. 2
programme.desc: Rugged rocks, blue sea and idyllic, sandy beaches - this is the Mediterranean as we know it. But this impression is deceptive: the Mediterranean is under constant change. The continents are moving towards one another. Animals, that have to survive under such extreme conditions, must find a way to escape the dangers. Between deserts and volcanoes, the challenges for the animals are enormous.

programme.title: Chiemgau, A Changing Landscape
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Chiemgau, A Changing Landscape: Episode 1
programme.desc: A few thousand years ago, there were bare moraine ridges and barren meltwater valleys here. A landscape born in the last ice age, characterized by the edge of the Alps, gentle hills, moors, and lakes. And by cultural richness, not only on the islands in Lake Chiemsee, with their famous monasteries and castles. Long before King Ludwig II, the first people settled in the Chiemgau region. Finds of hunting weapons from the Neanderthal era prove that the land was inhabited even during the ice age, probably because there was plenty of game to hunt. During the Bronze Age, one of the most important trade routes from the mountains to the Alpine foothills passed through here. Then came the Celts...

programme.title: Chiemgau, A Changing Landscape
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Chiemgau, A Changing Landscape: Episode 2
programme.desc: Three times in the past two decades, the Chiemsee area has experienced "once-in-a-century" floods. Climate, wildlife, and landscape have changed, and it seems this transformation is accelerating. Species living in the flood zones are developing sophisticated survival strategies. Knot ants, for instance, place their queen in the middle and form a raft with their bodies, even conquering new habitats. Flooding is less of a disaster for nature and impacts humans more significantly.

programme.title: Europes Wild River - The Elbe - 1.000 Miles of Wildlife and Nature
programme.desc: The river rises in the Czech Giant Mountains. Here it is called the Labe. After Děčín it flows into Germany and is called Elbe. There are various explanations for the origin of the river name "Elbe". One often mentioned is the Latin name of the river "albia", which means "bright water". This would also explain why the stream is referred to with the feminine article "the Elbe", since the Latin term "albia" is also feminine. Rather poetic than linguistically probable, however, is the explanation that elves (Middle High German: alb) scurrying around the pines in the white river mists could have helped the river to get its name. Geographically, the river can be divided into different...

programme.title: Alpine Lakes - Dark Depths and Icy Heights
programme.desc: This is a nature documentary, which leads us into the fascinating world of deep mountain lakes. We conquer ice palaces of unsuspected beauty. In the freezers, in which elves, fairies and mountain trolls once did their mischief, we move, using a special breathing technique and with special cameras in search of nocturnal hunters, whose eyes are equipped with residual light amplifying receptors.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The Secret World of Herbs - In Provence
programme.desc: Its native fragrant flowers and aromatic herbs have made the Provence a brand known worldwide. The wealth of flora found in this region, between the French Alps and the Mediterranean, is unequalled among the French provinces. Around Sault, near Mont Ventoux, the valleys and high plains are carpeted with bright violet: In the hot climate of the South of France, lavender blooms and exudes its fragrance. Monastic healers have been using its aromatic medicinal oil since the Middle Ages. And today an entire industry is based on the trade with this fragrant flower. Yet the livelihood of Provençal lavender farmers is imperiled. In France’s major lavender-growing region, the “Plateau de...

programme.title: Elephants: Back to the Wild
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Elephants: Back to the Wild: The Return of the Elephants - Tsavo-East-Nationalpark
programme.desc: We accompany the first steps of a two-year-old elephant who is just starting his release program. We also observe the story of two young elephants in their first night in the wilderness on their own. Captivating film footage allows us to truly learn how elephants behave in the wild.

programme.title: Wildlife Diaries Australia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Of Flying Foxes and Heat Waves
programme.desc: While the Tolga Bat Hospital is looking after endangered flying foxes, researchers are using thermographic cameras to search for flying foxes and koalas. But they can also detect bush and wildfire more quickly.

programme.title: Wildlife Diaries Australia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Of Sea Turtles and Coral Reefs
programme.desc: The Cairns Turtle Rehabilitation Center (CTRC) raises and cares for sick, or injured turtles, while the Schmidt Ocean Institute goes on a diving mission with a high-tech underwater rover. In this way, we learn firsthand about the state of Australias sensitive marine animals natural habitat and what needs to be done to ensure their survival.

programme.title: Wildlife Diaries Australia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Of Wombats and Vaccines
programme.desc: Tasmanias Bonorong Wildlife Sanctuary used to be a traditional wildlife park - now it is an innovative and active wildlife sanctuary and home to the famous Tasmanian Devil, to wombats, and many other native species. But unfortunately, "Tassie Devils" are particularly endangered by the Devil Facial Tumor Disease (DFTD). We accompany the team of young, ambitious scientists on their fight against the disease.

programme.title: Wildlife Diaries Australia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Of Koalas and Drones
programme.desc: Lone Pine Koala Sanctuary was opened in 1927 at a time when Koalas were still being killed on a large scale for the fur trade. Today, hardly anything threatens the natural habitats of these animals as much as the desertification of the forests. We let the drones fly and are there when a new tree is planted.

programme.title: Wildlife Diaries Australia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 wOf Kangaroos and Conservation
programme.desc: Visiting the fenced nature reserve Arid Recovery in southern Australia, we witness the care of an injured kangaroo and follow researchers at the Hidden Vale Wildlife Centre near Brisbane as they train native animals to detect tracks of threatening predators and then move to safety.

programme.title: Wildlife Diaries Australia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Of Fairy Penguins and GPS Trackers
programme.desc: Australias largest fur seal colony is located on Phillip Island. Night after night, a breathtaking spectacle takes place here: At sunset, countless fairy penguins return from their hunt for fish. In the station near the penguin colony, pioneering scientific research is conducted around the cute animals. We learn how dedicated scientists are trying to secure the future of the fairy penguins with the help of GPS trackers.

programme.title: Rewilding: Back to Nature
programme.desc: Worldwide, there are various projects and approaches to give nature more space again. The aim is to create larger wilderness areas that develop with hardly any influence of humans - by reintroducing so-called key animal species and creating a network of wilderness corridors across entire continents. Rewilding promises to be a cost-effective form of conservation in which we can boost biodiversity and protect the climate.

programme.title: Raising Wildlife
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Baboon, Cheetah, Bush Baby
programme.desc: An orphaned baby baboon has enjoyed the love of its human foster mother at CARE, an emergency wildlife center. How will he respond when he meets his first baboon friend? This is an important milestone in becoming a member of a troop. Animal rescuers from the Wildlife Foundation in Namibia need to catch a young female cheetah in captivity; this is tricky and potentially dangerous work. Their plan is to reunite her with her mother so that she can learn how to function and survive in the wild. Bush babies are especially cute so sometimes they are kept as pets. The care givers at Riverside Wildlife Centre put emotions aside and prepare one for release in the wild.

programme.title: Raising Wildlife
programme.desc: Rhino horn is more valuable than gold and more recent increases in poaching leaves the survival of this species at risk. Every day a rhino monitoring team at Somkhanda Game Reserve keeps track of a rhino and her calf, but skilful tracking and telemetry don’t guarantee that they’ll find them. When it comes to their milk feed, the competition is fierce for four orphaned baby dassies at Daktari Wildlife Orphanage. Their care taker forms strong bonds with the animals he looks after and decides to visit the rocky outcrop where he’s released a dassie – can he find his friend? A baby porcupine is hand-reared at Tenikwa Wildlife and Rehabilitation Centre. Can his surrogate mom teach him to...

programme.title: Raising Wildlife
programme.desc: Raising wildlife can be a long-term commitment: elephant calves are dependent on their mothers for three years and chimpanzees rely on special attention for about seven. In this episode, we visit the Lilayi Elephant Nursery in Zambia and the Mefou Primate Park in Cameroon to meet the highly committed people who take on this responsibility. Night or day, a baby elephant can never be left alone and many of the chimpanzee orphans arrive highly traumatised. Their care givers need to work very hard to restore their trust and will to live. At the Kwaggasvlaktes Wildlife Centre in South Africa some baby Wildebeest rely on heart-warming help from humans and an unusual sheep to survive.

programme.title: Raising Wildlife
programme.desc: An African penguin chick has survived expulsion from the nest, but can surgery help an adult who’s been savaged by a seal to see the ocean again? All in a day’s job at the South African Marine Rehabilitation and Education Centre where a caregiver’s fingers also narrowly escape the razor-sharp beak of a gannet. Something stands in the way of a high spirited young caracal, but the Sondela Wildlife Centre are hatching a plan to secure his release back in the wild. Two baby warthogs at the Gitta Martula Rehabilitation Wildlife Centre still prefer their apples to their potatoes but, slowly and surely, they are being adjusted to living in their natural environment – the whole wild world awaits.

programme.title: Raising Wildlife
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Wild Dog, Baboon, Antelope
programme.desc: Rehabilitating and teaching young wild dog packs to hunt is what Margerita does at Erindi Private Game Reserve in Namibia. Margerita had discovered many of the wild dog packs in the region had succumb to illness and died. Margerita took it upon herself to raise an abandoned young pack of wild dogs. She teaches them to run as a pack, hunt as a pack and survive as a pack thus ensuring when the time comes the wild dog pack will survive in the wild. Alma’s passion for yellow baboons in Malawi brought her to the African continent to live-out her passion. Her daily chores, activities and inspections keep her busy. Two yellow baboons meet each other for the first time when the gate separating...

programme.title: Raising Wildlife
programme.desc: Lindi, the one-eyed Lion cub lives at Wildthingz Lodge situated in the northern region of South Africa. Having one eye does not restrict Lindi from been a playful and energetic lion cub. Skabenga, a young Hyena, also lives at Wildthingz. Skabenga has almost become part of the family, and his bond to his caretaker cannot be denied. Wolves in Africa? Tsitsikamma Wolf Sanctuary is an orphanage to abandoned wolves. Raising wolves on the other hand is not always an easy job. This is the case with an energetic seven-month-old wolf, Raul who knows no boundaries. We meet Victor Hugo at Somkhanda where the motto is to keep all the animals wild while rehabilitating them. We will meet a herd of...

programme.title: Raising Wildlife
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Vervet monkey, Cheetah, Kudu
programme.desc: It’s not surprising that raising the fastest animal on the planet involves regular exercise; Frank Kasakamula at the Ranch Conservancy in South Africa has a number of strategies in place for the cheetah in his care. A traumatised, orphaned baby Vervet monkey is especially clingy and demanding. But from nappy rash to night feeds, Dean Oakes at the Bambelela Wildlife Sanctuary takes everything involved in being a ‘good mother’ in his stride. Everyone at the Harnas Wildlife Foundation in Namibia has a right to life, including a blind, baby kudu named Derek. Soon his care taker, Louis Duvenhage, will introduce him to its new friends: a Springbok and a Duiker.

programme.title: Raising Wildlife
programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 Grey Duiker, Silverback Gorilla
programme.desc: In the Centre for Rehabilitation of Wildlife situated in KwaZulu Natal, South Africa, junior nurse Kylie is preparing grey duiker Major for his release into the wild. Major had suffered several injuries when he arrived at the centre, but with Kylie’s help he recovered, and he will soon be back in his natural environment. We also travel to the Eastern Cape in South Africa to the main port city called, Port Elizabeth. Here Ruth, a dedicated animal caretaker, is constantly monitoring her loggerhead turtle hatchling Rocky, who has trouble with weight fluctuations. But once his nutrition is balanced enough that he can keep his weight for several weeks, he can be released into the Indian...

programme.title: Raising Wildlife
programme.desc: In this episode, we travel to Howick in Kwa-Zulu Natal, South Africa to a Centre called FreeMe Wildlife Rehabilitation. Here we meet Kirsten, also known as ‘Otter Mom number 1’. Kirsten is training her three orphaned Otters how to swim and hunt. The three mammals, Juliet, Oberon and Othelloe have almost completed their rehabilitation. After preparing the release site for two weeks it is time to return the three siblings back into the river. But persuading them to leave their temporary home might be more of a challenge than Kirsten anticipated. Situated at the base of the Hlumu Hlumu Mountains in the province of Mpumalanga in South Africa we find DIY Wildlife Rehabilitation. Animal...

programme.title: Raising Wildlife
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 White Rhino, Giant Pouched Rat, Bat
programme.desc: At the Hoedspruit Endangered Species Centre in the province of Limpopo we meet a member of one of the most threatened species on the planet, a white rhino named Esme. Caretaker Natasha is looking after the nine-month-old and makes sure it can develop in a well-protected surrounding. And she has got some help from a rather unexpected companion for the little calf - a dog named David. Further north we visit Tanzania, where so-called “Hero Rats” are fulfilling special tasks. These giant pouched rats are able to detect landmines and sniff out diseases. One of these little heroes named Sykwalker is learning how to detect tuberculosis. Caretaker Estadiov provides us an insight into the training...

programme.title: Raising Wildlife
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 Cheetah, Honey Badger, Blue Duiker
programme.desc: An hour’s drive from Johannesburg Warren is raising three cheetah cubs at the Lion and Cheetah Sanctuary. They are an endangered species – not only in South Africa but around the world. Warren is taking the three orphaned siblings for walks on a daily basis to give them the opportunity to experience being outside their enclosure. This is part of the preparation for their return to the wild. Convincing them to leave the enclosure is easy, trying to get them back in is a difficult task to undertake. In the South African Limpopo province, we meet clinic manager Nikita at the Moholoholo Animal Rehabilitation Centre. She’s taking care of several different animals all of whom got their own sad...

programme.title: Raising Wildlife
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 Wild Dog, Owls, Bat Eared Foxes
programme.desc: At the Loebis Predator Park in Bela-Bella, a town in the South African Limpopo region, caretaker Annel is looking after orphaned animal babys. Part of her gang of little rascals are a wild dog puppy and a porcupine – both two months old – who have an unlikely friendship and team up against a greedy little predator who likes to steel their food – a same-aged lion cub. But in the end, all of them get along very well – even with the cheeky little mongooses. The highlight of our visit there is the birth of two new members of this unusual family. We also meet Deidre Joubert at the Wild and Free Wildlife Rehabilitation Centre in Mpumalanga who takes care of young barn owls and prepares a bunch...

programme.title: Raising Wildlife
programme.sub-title: S01 : E13 Tiger, Black Leopard, Serval
programme.desc: In the Wokutakula Wildlife Rescue Centre located in Brits, 85 kilometres north of Johannesburg animal caretaker Juan is looking after a partially blind juvenile Tiger called Felix. Juan rescued the exotic animal just moments before it was going to be traded overseas. He tried to treat the tiger’s eye condition but so far, his efforts were unsuccessful. There is no hope for Felix to be returned to the wild, but she has adapted to her new life – thanks to other Tigers, who accompany her and Juan, who sheperds her as good as he can. In the province of Limpopo, we meet Laita at the Moholoholo Animal Rehabilitation Centre. She takes care of two precious juveniles: a Black Leopard and a Serval....

programme.title: Elephants: Back to the Wild
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Elephants: Back to the Wild: The Orphanage of Elephants - Nairobi Nationalpark
programme.desc: We follow the rescue of a baby elephant. Once rescued, it will be transported by plane to the breeding station and raised with love and commitment. In order to satisfy the little pachyderm’s urge to move while in the breeding station, there is sometimes an adorable football match between the animals.

programme.title: Elephants: Back to the Wild
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Elephants: Back to the Wild: The Return of the Elephants - Tsavo-East-Nationalpark
programme.desc: We accompany the first steps of a two-year-old elephant who is just starting his release program. We also observe the story of two young elephants in their first night in the wilderness on their own. Captivating film footage allows us to truly learn how elephants behave in the wild.

programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Of Flying Foxes and Heat Waves
programme.desc: While the Tolga Bat Hospital is looking after endangered flying foxes, researchers are using thermographic cameras to search for flying foxes and koalas. But they can also detect bush and wildfire more quickly.

A baby porcupine is hand-reared at Tenikwa Wildlife and Rehabilitation Centre. Can his surrogate mom teach him to...

At the Kwaggasvlaktes Wildlife Centre in South Africa some baby Wildebeest rely on heart-warming help from humans and an unusual sheep to survive.

programme.title: Wild Bavaria
programme.desc: The moon disappears behind the horizon and the stage is set for a new day in the Alps of Berchtesgaden.

programme.title: Wild Bavaria
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Wild Bavaria - In The Shadow of the Watzmann.
programme.desc: Mighty and mysterious, King Watzmann sits above Germanys only alpine national park.

programme.title: Wild Baltic
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Wild Baltic - Life on the Amber Coast
programme.desc: The first episode of this two-part nature documentary presents the natural beauty of the shifting sand dunes of the Curonian Spit, the romantic beaches of the Latvian Baltic Sea and the island worlds of Estonia. Time and again, this deserted and almost untouched nature fascinates. In the winter, ringed seals give birth to their young on the pack ice. In the spring, Konik wild horse stallions fight fierce battles amongst themselves, while colourful European rollers fly through the dune forests. Lynxes wander through the coastal forests and in the orchid meadows turncoats and hoopoes find more than enough food. On the islands around Saaremaa in Estonia, grey seals hunt for fish. They share...

programme.desc: Africanews is the only independent national and international news channel from an African perspective. It reports breaking news from the continent, delivers unbiased reporting and is available on TV and digital platforms.

programme.desc: Baby Shark Fire Rescue Team, Go! Brave Baby Shark rushes to help friends in danger—anytime, anywhere! Join exciting rescue missions and become a hero firefighter!

programme.title: Baby Shark Halloween Fun
programme.desc: On a spooky Halloween night, someone is shouting in the distance: “I’m huuungry!” Rumble rumble—to feed the hungry guests, Baby Shark’s Halloween food truck is on its way! “Welcome to Baby Shark’s Halloween Food Truck! What would you like to eat?”

programme.title: Baby Shark Back to School
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Baby Shark Back to School
programme.desc: After an exciting summer vacation, Baby Shark is back at school! Join Baby Shark for a day in the life after the new school term begins.

programme.title: Monkey Bananas Dance
programme.desc: What happened to the monkey family that went to eat bananas? Dance along with Pinkfong, Baby Shark, and Hoi!

programme.title: Outdoors Songs
programme.desc: Hi, friends. Ready for playtime? Yeah! How about we go to the woods and play?

programme.title: Animal Fun Facts Songs
programme.desc: Find out fun facts about animals with Pinkfong and Ninimo.So much fun!

programme.title: Learn Colors with Hogi
programme.desc: Learn colors with Hogi and Wonderville Friends.

programme.title: Super Solver SAMMY 2
programme.desc: There is always Sammy next to Pinkfong and friends, where incidents and accidents never cease. But... the solving process is a mess!? Well, anyway, the clumsy problem solver Sammy gets things done!

programme.title: Vampire Wedding with Hogi
programme.desc: Come, and join Jeni and Billis wedding ceremony!

programme.title: Hide n Seek with Shark Family 4
programme.desc: Oh? Where did Baby Shark and Shark Family go? Help Pinkfong to find all the Shark Family!

programme.title: Baby Shark Monthly
programme.desc: All your favorite baby sharks

programme.title: Pinkfongs Farm Animals
programme.desc: Welcome to Pinkfong’s farm! Youre watching "Pinkfong’s Farm", fun and educational Animal Songs presented by Pinkfong! Learn all about different farm animals with all-new Pinkfongs Animal Songs!

programme.title: Bebefinn Dance Time
programme.desc: Have fun dancing and singing with Bebefinn! Its dance time with mom and dad, or with siblings!

programme.title: Pinkfong and Hogi Mini-Movie: The Tricky Three Cars
programme.sub-title: S00 : E01 Pinkfong and Hogi Mini-Movie: The Tricky Three Cars
programme.desc: Join Hogi on a fun-filled adventure! When the Tricky Three Cars take Pinkfong and Wonderstar friends away, its up to Hogi to save the day! Follow Hogi on a thrilling journey of courage and friendship. Can Hogi bring the friends back home safely?

programme.title: Arc: A Love Story
programme.desc: Lines are crossed and friendships tested when friends Ben and Naomi grow closer together amid a failed relationship and a broken marriage.

programme.title: Family Games
programme.desc: Sloane and her boyfriend Barrett return to her childhood home determined to ruin her father Roans re-marriage. Family secrets surface and give rise to a puzzling future.

programme.title: Out Past Dark
programme.desc: Gregory and Matilda put pressure on a weekend getaway to resolve all of their issues, but their toxicity intermixes with the folklore of the town.

programme.title: Damaged Goods
programme.desc: Amandas life might not be ideal--her ex-boyfriend is taking her money, her boss is threatening to fire her, and her landlord wont fix her apartment--but shes absolutely fine.

programme.title: Blur Circle
programme.desc: A feature film about a woman grieving the loss of her son after he disappeared two years ago - until a mysterious man with a camera enters her life.

programme.title: Everything I Am
programme.desc: A young teenage girl takes a homeless man into her home, to show the love of christianity in action.

programme.title: Core
programme.desc: A woman rediscovers a relationship shes neglected when her world comes crashing down.

programme.title: Who Will Move The Stone
programme.desc: A worldly Detroit lawyer decides to represent a Born Again Christian on trial for the murder of a Catholic Priest.

programme.title: Lucky Louie
programme.desc: A retired cop teams up with four ex-convicts and a behavioral science student to solve a fifty year old bank robbery in this new faith filled family comedy.

programme.title: Someone I Used to Know
programme.desc: An overweight man meets a former classmate on their high school track. As the two grow close and inspire each other, their pasts creep back into their lives and begin to threaten all that they have developed.

programme.title: Bittersweet Monday
programme.desc: An emotional goodbye between longtime best friends begins an unexpected love affair, putting two marriages and many friendships at stake.

programme.title: Finding Grace
programme.desc: A struggling family, already on the verge of disintegration, faces new challenges that will test their faith in God and each other.

programme.title: Royal Ashes
programme.desc: Nineteen year old Paul Royal is trapped in a life he didnt ask for.

programme.title: 6 Nonsmokers
programme.desc: Dr. Henry Caldwell, the world’s foremost mediator, faces the biggest challenge of his career when he takes on six roommates whose only thing in common is that none of them smoke.

programme.title: Beverly Hills Bandits
programme.desc: When bratty 5-year-old Byron Reed (Chris Williams) acts out the night before a family trip, his mother (Natasha Alam) makes him sit in the time out chair. When Byron awakens to an empty house, he assumes his wish to have no family has come true.

programme.title: At the Frontera
programme.desc: When an ATF agent out of Houston is tasked to team up with the Mexico City District Attorney on a human trafficking case, he uncovers family ties with a serpentine real-estate developer. Now he must work with a criminal defense attorney to stop the reign of tyranny.

programme.title: Broken Contract
programme.desc: When Max, a down on his luck strip club owner, has his life and livelihood threatened by local gangsters, he turns to his wife’s connections for help and hires a hitman to solve the problem once and for all.

programme.title: Octopus Pot
programme.desc: A broken man finds the one thing he cant live without only to lose it. He cant bring back the woman he loves, but he can cover the ground with the blood of his enemy.

programme.title: If You Only Knew
programme.desc: This is the story of Louise, a fashion designer that develops Alzheimer at an early age, presumably because she was abused when younger by her boyfriend.

programme.title: When We Last Spoke
programme.desc: Two abandoned sisters live with their grandparents in Texas in 1967.

programme.title: The Ribbon
programme.desc: Molly and Tim are happy newlyweds, but an unexpected miscarriage threatens to tear them apart until they meet Kristin, a pregnant homeless girl in need of a family.

programme.title: Clarity
programme.desc: When 20-year-old Maggie collapses at a surprise celebration dinner, her family discover that she has a rare genetic kidney disorder.

programme.title: Betrayed
programme.desc: In an effort to control the city the Mayor opens the doors to the Russian Mob. It is not long until he realizes they arent going to follow his rules.

programme.title: Bathing Franky
programme.desc: When an ex-con falls under the spell of a backyard magician, the illusion is shattered.

programme.title: American Sophmore
programme.desc: A group of high school kids enjoy many adventures throughout their formative tenth grade year.

programme.title: The Fat Boy Chronicles
programme.desc: Jimmy always gets teased by the football team for being overweight. As a school assignment he writes about it in his journal, but soon he finds out that he’s not the only kid in school with problems.

programme.title: Crazy
programme.desc: Inspired by the life of Hank Garland, CRAZY is the story of a legendary guitar player who emerged from Nashville in the 1950s.

programme.title: Druid Peak
programme.desc: A troubled teen is sent to live with his estranged father, a park ranger. During his time there, he develops an unusual affinity with and passion for the wolves in a local pack.

programme.title: Vincents Vow
programme.desc: A broken 30-year-old man who struggles with commitment, accepts a challenge to "learn what love is before claiming to love someone". The results are certainly not what hed expect.

programme.title: 2 Weeks in Lagos
programme.desc: The film captures the excitement and vibrancy of everyday life in Lagos and reflects the complexity of life in Lagos, a dynamic city where anything is possible in 2 Weeks.

programme.title: Milla: The Movie
programme.desc: THE WORST NIGHTMARE RESTS WHERE NOT EXPECTED

programme.title: Dead on Arrival
programme.desc: A pharmaceutical sales rep visits a small town in Louisiana on business. He finds himself in a dark world of corruption and murder with 24 hours to live, running from the police.

programme.title: The Colonizer
programme.desc: When a devout Christian struggles to align his principles against the challenges of an unexpected, boundary-pushing stranger, he must persevere without losing his Faith.

programme.title: Tie the Knot
programme.desc: The hysterical cross cultural journey of hearts.

programme.title: Today’s Top Pick
programme.desc: Documentaries in this slot are rebroadcasts of our most-viewed and most popular stories of the season. They feature important social, economic, environmental or other policy-driven issues, affecting lives nationwide or simply in one small village. A broad selection of top productions by Chinese top documentary producers.

programme.title: Humanities and Geography

programme.title: Cops

programme.title: Cops

programme.title: Cops

programme.title: Cops

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: An investigation involving two suspicious men in parked cars results in a foot chase and drug bust. An officer responds to a domestic call involving a threatening exhusband who is taken into custody. Officers in Florida question a deceptive and drug using couple.

programme.title: Wiseguy
programme.desc: While David and Eli move to close their most important knock-off dress deal ever, Pinzolo uses the same deal-- and information from someone close to David-- in an attempt to bury Eli and Elrose Fashions for good.

programme.title: Wiseguy
programme.desc: Vinnies resignation from the Organized Crime Bureau leads him home and into a hotbed of racial hatred.

programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 School Of Hard Knox

programme.title: Wiseguy
programme.desc: When Mel Profitts armaments deals go sour, he sends Vinnie back East to set up a narcotics import distribution deal with the mob

programme.title: Wiseguy

programme.title: Silk Stalkings
programme.desc: Rita and Chris are not quite convinced that a double murder in a hairstyling salon is a mob hit.

programme.title: Silk Stalkings
programme.desc: Tom and Cassy investigate the death of a prep school student whose blackmail scheme led to his murder.

programme.title: Silk Stalkings

programme.sub-title: S08 : E04 All The Worlds A Stage

programme.desc: Michael and Holly question a battered womans story after her abusive husband is murdered.

programme.desc: Rita and Chris suspect Donovans young girlfriend is behind a deadly extortion scheme.

programme.desc: When a pimp is found murdered, Chris and Rita are lead to suspect a pair of women in his employ.

programme.desc: Chance events trap hitch-hiker Al Roberts in a tightening net of film noir trouble.

programme.title: D.O.A.
programme.desc: Frank Bigelow, told hes been poisoned and has only a few days to live, tries to find who killed him and why.

programme.title: Renegade
programme.desc: Bobby finds his liquid assets quickly evaporating when his banker embezzles 150 million dollars and heads to sunny Mexico.

programme.title: Renegade
programme.desc: Reno finds himself in the Old West when he encounters trouble in a ghost town.

programme.title: Renegade
programme.desc: Reno finds his patience tested while attempting to protect a wealthy socialite and murder witness.

programme.title: Renegade
programme.desc: The five-year old disappearance of B-movie starlet sends Reno south of the border, following a hot tip from one of Bobbys informants.

programme.title: Renegade
programme.sub-title: S04 : E12 No Place Like Home
programme.desc: Reno investigates a parolee who claims he was wrongly accused of rape.

programme.title: Renegade
programme.desc: Reno finds himself in a dangerous web when his former partner turns to him for help in locating a dirty cop she testified against who has now issued a "contract" on her life.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 The Big September Man
programme.desc: Someone murdered a secretary late at night in her office. She was beaten to death with a metal pipe wrapped in newspaper. Could it be the drunk found three blocks away beating his head against a wall?

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.sub-title: S03 : E31 The Big Hit-Run Killer
programme.desc: The detectives try to track down a tall, beautiful woman who has been terrorizing the city by robbing men, beating them up and in some cases shooting them. Their job is made more difficult by the fact that there are many inconsistencies in the victims reports.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: Friday and Smith are assigned to investigate the strangulation of an unidentified woman in a hotel room. With no leads and no clues, and no idea of who she is, they must start from scratch to find her killer.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 The Big September Man
programme.desc: Someone murdered a secretary late at night in her office. She was beaten to death with a metal pipe wrapped in newspaper. Could it be the drunk found three blocks away beating his head against a wall?

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: Executive leaves suicide note in his car with pistol, two bullets spent and no trace of the body. Friday and Smith working Homicide, Missing Persons Detail, begin their search for the man.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: Friday leads a team in a raid on the house of a very dangerous armed robber, which results in a bloody shootout.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.sub-title: S03 : E17 The Big Little Jesus
programme.desc: Its Christmas Eve when Father Rojas at the Old Mission Plaza Church in Los Angeles discovers that the statue of the Infant Jesus is stolen from the crib. The statues worth is only a few dollars, but it is of great sentimental value for the parish. Friday and Smith promise to try to get it back before mass on Christmas Day, but this means that they have less than 24 hours to catch the thief.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: A holdup man is sticking up bars. After he takes the money he kills many of his victims. Sargeant Friday has few leads other than that the holdup man likes a certain song on the jukebox and likes to drink scotch and water.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: Three men are the suspects in the beating death of a former vaudevillian actress found in her apartment. The possible reason for her murder could be among the contents of an old steamer trunk which she kept locked in her room. Surveillance equipment is used to solve the mystery.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: A lady reports an abandoned baby at a bus depot. Officers Friday and Smith investigate, and realize her story doesnt quite hold water.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: Sgt. Friday, Smith and newly married Sgt. Austin investigate a string of robberies taking place when people are on vacation. They track some of the property and learn of a moving van that appears at the empty houses.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: Obscene literature and pictures are spread among youngster at a school in Los Angeles. The supplier of this illegal stuff turns out to be a former film producer from the days of silent movies.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: A gang of con artists checks the obituary section of the daily newspaper, then uses the information they gather to prey on the grief-stricken families of those who have recently died.

programme.title: Hunter
programme.desc: McCall goes undercover to help Hunter investigate the deaths of two models involved in pornographic films.

programme.title: Hunter
programme.desc: Son of a mobster, Detective Sergeant Rick Hunter and Sergeant Dee Dee McCall team up to catch a serial killer.

programme.title: Hunter
programme.desc: When a convicted murderer commits suicide, his vengeful brother holds McCall and a judge shes dating captive.

programme.title: Hunter
programme.desc: A dispatcher is blackmailed into undermining Hunters and McCalls investigation of a gold robbery.

programme.title: Hunter
programme.desc: A Colombian drug dealer is murdered, and police informant Sporty James becomes the prime suspect.

programme.title: Hunter
programme.sub-title: S02 : E22 The Return Of Typhoon Thompson
programme.desc: Hunter and Dee get a murder case reopened in order to exonerate a paroled ex-boxer and find the real killer.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On March 28th 2013, the burnt body of Anne Barbot, 38 years old, is discovered in a forest of Maine-et-Loire.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On May 17th 2005, a body is discovered in a forest of Sucy-en-Brie; Christophe Belle, 40 years old, a renowned pastry cook.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: The disturbing missing case in Paris of a four year old.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On October 13th 1996, the body of young Angelique Dumetz, 18 years old, is recovered down a ditch in Oise forest. An important clue is found on the crime scene.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On February 23th 2017, policemen are alerted of the disapearrance of Brigitte Troadec, her husband Pascal, and their children Sebastien and Charlotte.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A Night of Horror at Devils Plateau (Marie-Jeanne Meyer Case) - On June 18, 2011, Marie-Jeanne Meyer, 17-years old, waved goodbye to her little sister before leaving for her daily jog on the heights of Tournon in Ardèche. She never came back. Three days later, her mutilated body was found in a freshly dug pit, near an area known to be cursed, "The Devils Plateau." Whats more, the crime scene looked like a mystical ritual ... Was it a ritual murder? Revenge? An unfortunate encounter? ...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A Mysterious Murder at the Farm (Valerie Bary Case)- On Friday, March 26, 2004, in the region of Dijon, Laurent Bary came home from his work to discover the lifeless body of his wife, Valerie, bathing in a pool of blood. According to the investigators initial findings, the 38-year-old nurses aid had been stabbed several times, seeming to validate the theory of a robbery gone wrong.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On July 13, 2011, two boaters retrieved a suitcase that was floating in the bay of Lorient. Inside, they discovered the tied up corpse of a man.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Bloody Christmas next to the Leman lake (CASE OF RUTH LÉGERET) - On January 4, 2006, Ruth Legeret was found dead in the middle of a pool of blood at her luxurious property in Vevey, Switzerland. Next to her was the lifeless body of her friend, Marina Studer. Who could have killed these two simple and wealthy widows? Clue after clue, the Swiss polices investigation would revolve around an environment of family jealousy and financial greed.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: September 16 2005. The lifeless body of Audrey Jouannet, 24, is found hidden under the bed in her small apartment in Soisy-sur-Seine. It soon becomes apparent that the young woman has been tortured at length before being strangled. But surprisingly, though the highly meticulous murderer has taken care to leave no sign of his passage, the autopsy reveals traces of sperm on the victim. It will take all of the investigators intuition to pierce the mystery of this heinous crime...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Sylvain Dromard finds the body of his wife Laurence lying in a pool of blood in the kitchen. The crime was particularly violent and the theory of a burglary that went wrong is soon excluded. But investigators dont understand who could want the adorable hairdresser of Saint-Martin-dAblois dead. During the investigation, the work of profilers will enable them to draw a very precise portrait of the murderer...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: After an ordinary dinner, Pierre and Gabrielle Labrell suffer severe abdominal pains.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Nelly Cremel, 39, leaves her home to go jogging... never to return. Eight days later, after a vast search campaign, her body is found. Theres no doubt that its murder. The case soon ignites public opinion, even inflaming passions at the highest level of the state. The clues lead investigators on a number of trails, from the shadows of the French secret service to a manhunt for a possible sex maniac, in a case of murder most foul.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Willy Pomonti, a retired architect, is found savagely murdered in his opulent villa in La Celle-Saint-Cloud, near Paris. It soon becomes clear that the man has been tortured prior to death. At several points during this extraordinary enquiry, police will feel theyre holding the culprit... It will take them ten years to finally shed light on this particularly violent crime.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: The lifeless body of Christophe Lejard is found by his son just metres from their home. The man was shot in the head as he was getting into his car to go to work. A veritable execution, which at first glance doesnt square with the profile of the quiet family man. Yet behind the appearances, the investigation gradually reveals all the hate and resentment that revolved around the victim.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A man walks into a gendarmerie near Saint-Malo to report that his wife has been missing since the previous day. The couple are going through a divorce, but this mother would never have left her seven children alone! An extensive search is undertaken but the woman cannot be found. What has happened to Adeline Piet? The investigation spans several years and experiences many twists.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: The corpse of Priscillia Ciatti, 14, is discovered by the side of a field, a few hundred metres from her family home. The teenager has been stabbed sixty times with a knife and -an extra sordid detail - a devil mask is found next to her body. Was Priscillia the victim of a prowler? A serial killer? A maniac inspired by a horror movie? Investigators soon find that the young girl felt she was being watched, and even threatened...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: In the early hours of the morning, Mathilde Croguennec, 18, attending "Teknival" in Brittany, is found at the foot of a tree with her throat cut. Investigators face the task of finding the killer from among the 43,000 participants of this huge open-air festival of electronic music, where drink and drugs are consumed in abundance. An unusual investigation that leads the police down a number of false avenues.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Arriving at her work, the secretary of a small firm in the suburbs of Geneva finds the body of Jean-Raymond Blatti, the companys new accountant. The man is lying in a pool of blood and, on his belly, the murderer has written "DIRTY RAPIST". Yet Jean-Raymond Blatti was never charged with sexual assault. Over the course of the investigation, this inscription will appear as one of the many mysteries of this case which is particularly rich in twists and turns.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On July 19th 2004, the naked and tied up body of a woman is recovered in the Ourcq canal in Fresnes-sur-Marne. The victim is impossible to identify.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On April 3th 2003, Chantal Ternik, a 48 year old housewife, is discovered hanged in her house of Sanary-sur-Mer, in Var.

programme.title: Search for Our Suns Lost Planet
programme.desc: Is it possible that there is a hidden planet within our own solar system? New evidence suggests that the fabled Planet X, or Planet 9, may indeed exist… but where?

programme.title: Mars Perseverance: The Hunt Begins
programme.desc: Watch as the Mars Perseverance Rover makes its historic landing on the Red Planet. We take you inside the harrowing February 18, 2021 landing and its science mission.

programme.title: Capturing A Black Hole In Our Milky Way
programme.desc: Astronomers linked radio dishes around the world to create the “Event Horizon Telescope” and have utilized this tool to photograph a supermassive black hole.

programme.title: Private Moonshot
programme.desc: A non-profit organization established in 2011 is aiming to land the first Israeli spacecraft on the Moon. This is the story of their attempt and the excitement of being the first private company to have a spacecraft launched with the intention of going to and landing on the moon.

programme.title: Modern Day Killer Asteroid
programme.desc: 66 million years ago, an asteroid slammed into Mexico’s Yucatán Peninsula, causing a dinosaur mass extinction. Whats in store for humanity if it happens again?

programme.title: Hayabusa2: Asteroid Explosion
programme.desc: Hayabusa2 just became the first spacecraft to take subsurface samples of an asteroid. How did they do it?

programme.title: Saturn: The Moon King
programme.desc: The latest developments in space technology continue to reveal the wonders of our solar system. With new moons recently spotted orbiting Saturn, the gas giant has taken the lead in our cosmic neighborhoods moon count.

programme.title: Artemis: First Launch
programme.desc: This is an inside look at NASAs groundbreaking Artemis Program, the spacecraft, and the people who will bring humanity one step closer to the moon, Mars, and beyond.

programme.title: First Images: The James Webb Telescope
programme.desc: The dawn of a new era in astronomy has begun as the world gets its first look at the full capabilities of NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope.

programme.title: Touching the Sun
programme.desc: NASAs Parker Probe Plus is on a mission to learn more about the Sun -- flying through dangerous radiation to become the closest spaceship to orbit our Sun.

programme.title: Crisis On Apollo 13
programme.desc: On the 50th Anniversary of Apollo 13, Commander Jim Lovell and Apollo engineers recall the ingenuity and superhuman efforts that turned a space flight disaster into an extraordinary fight for survival.

programme.title: Sailing to the Stars
programme.desc: Solar sails, the latest in space travel technology, could one day help us reach nearby stars. Follow the exciting missions laying the ground towards a new form of space exploration.

programme.title: First Steps to Mars
programme.desc: Humans seem to be on the cusp of reaching Mars, but how did we get to this point?

programme.title: Surviving Mars
programme.desc: Science may soon make the dream of traveling to Mars a reality, but how will we live once we get there?

programme.title: First Martians
programme.desc: Sometime in the future humans will leave Earth to colonize Mars, and in doing so will begin to adapt to life on another planet in surprising ways.

programme.title: Opportunity: A Life on Mars
programme.desc: This year we said goodbye to one of our most intrepid planetary explorers, the Opportunity rover. Take a look back at its storied 15-year mission on Mars.

programme.title: Search for Our Suns Lost Planet
programme.desc: Is it possible that there is a hidden planet within our own solar system? New evidence suggests that the fabled Planet X, or Planet 9, may indeed exist… but where?

programme.title: Blood Pattern Analysis
programme.desc: Can investigators decipher what happened at a crime scene based on the size and shape of bloodstains left behind? What can fluid dynamics tell us about the technique?

programme.title: Bite Mark Analysis
programme.desc: Bitemark Analysis appeared to fit neatly in the respected field of forensic dentistry until two researchers performed a bitemark study on cadavers.

programme.title: Firearm Examination
programme.desc: Firearms Analysis is one of the most relied upon forensic science methods in the US, but its foundational validity and reliability are now facing serious questions.

programme.title: Shaken Baby Syndrome
programme.desc: Shaken Baby Syndrome is a household name, but shockingly it may not be a valid diagnosis at all. New biomechanical research has changed the conversation.

programme.title: Footwear Analysis
programme.desc: Shoe prints seem like the most classic, helpful piece of evidence at a crime scene. But how does the science behind this comparison technique hold up?

programme.title: Arson Investigation
programme.desc: In just one generation Arson investigation changed from myth-based to a science-based discipline. What is the future for those still wrongly behind bars?

programme.title: Connecting To The Future
programme.desc: Host Derek Muller escorts us to the physical heart of the Internet, and demonstrates how Internet co-creators Vint Cerf and Bob Kahn devised a language.

programme.title: Man Vs. Machine
programme.desc: We peer inside "The Internet of Things" and reveal how web advertising, search engines and 24/7 surveillance have transformed our lives.

programme.title: Guardians Of The Web
programme.desc: Muller introduces viewers to "white" hackers, the U.S. Secret Service’s cybercrime division including West Point soldiers working to protect us from the Web.

programme.title: What is CRISPR?
programme.desc: On July 5, 1996, scientists cloned a sheep, Dolly. Now genetics have advanced to gene editing. Promising to pave the way for curing genetically carried illnesses.

programme.title: New Firefighting Tech
programme.desc: Firefighters have relied on the same basic tools for decades. But former NASA engineer Mike Ralston hopes to change that with MSTAR – a new breed of an emergency vehicle that brings a powerful suite of high-tech tools from Silicon Valley to the front lines of firefighting.

programme.title: Predicting A Pro
programme.desc: Increasingly high-tech tools are being used to evaluate youth baseball players. The question is can they outperform professional scouts?

programme.title: Path to the Pros
programme.desc: What does it take to become a professional tennis player? Both on and off the court preparations help build the strength of character and focused mind to take on the challenges of a sport that demands precision and superior athleticism.

programme.title: Rapidly Evolving Human with Spencer Wells
programme.desc: Renowned geneticist and author Spencer Wells reveals how changes in our genetic code have fueled major changes in our appearance and capabilities over time.

programme.title: The Dogs of Hurricane Dorian
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: Doug Thron takes his infrared drone from the hurricane-devastated Bahamas to the wildfire scorched hills of California, locating and rescuing dogs, horses, and more.

programme.title: Lost Dogs of Louisiana
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: In the wake of Hurricane Laura, Doug heads to Louisiana to help a local firefighter find his lost dog and begin rescue operations in the hard-hit city of Lake Charles.

programme.title: 13 Days After Hurricane Laura
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: With the help of expert animal rescuer, Aja Estro, Doug continues his tireless search and rescue missions across the town of Lake Charles following Hurricane Laura.

programme.title: Oregon Fire Cats
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: Doug ventures into the charred neighborhoods of Talent, OR with an old friend, Shannon Jay, to save any of the unlucky felines left behind in the wildfire evacuations.

programme.title: Puerto Rico Rescue Pups
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: Doug is called to Puerto Rico to help old friend and rescue partner, Aja Estro, with the massive stray dog population and hoarding cases across the island.

programme.title: Chasing Ghost
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: Doug checks in on some of the dogs he’s rescued before turning his attention to the high desert outside LA and a boxer who’s spent 15 months fending for itself.

programme.title: Island Dogs
programme.sub-title: S02 : E01 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: In our season opener, Doug takes his drone to the Dominican Republic to rescue puppies that have been abandoned in the municipal town dump.

programme.title: Urban Hyenas
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: Doug travels to Malawi, in Central Africa, to work with hyena researchers who are eager to employ his drone. What the infrared camera shows them will surprise them all.

programme.title: Bats of Malawi
programme.sub-title: S02 : E03 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: Doug visits Malawi, in Central Africa, to experiment in ways his drone can assist wildlife conservation research… pioneering work that can revolutionize field science.

programme.title: Dixie Fire Foxes
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: After the Dixie Fire devastates the CA town of Greenville, Doug heads in with his old friend Shannon to rescue the lost cats and wild animals that have been left behind.

programme.title: Tornado Town
programme.sub-title: S02 : E05 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: In the season finale, Doug takes his drone to the tornado-ravaged towns of Kentucky to rescue the slew of cats and dogs that have been lost in the brutal December storm.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.desc: Dr. G preforms an autopsy on an alleged hit-and-run victim but finds no evidence of vehicular injury.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.desc: Paramedics respond to a mother in distress: one of her infant twin girls hasnt woken up.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.sub-title: S04 : E02 Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An elderly woman is driving when shes overcome with shooting pains and crashes her car.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.sub-title: S05 : E17 Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When an infant dies under mysterious circumstances, the young parents are prime suspects.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.sub-title: S05 : E18 Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police make a grisly discovery: a womans battered and dead body.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.sub-title: S05 : E20 Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Its up to Dr. G to determine if alcohol was to blame in a mans death or if there was something else.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
